channel.title: Whonix for VirtualBox - 15.0.1.7.2 - Point Release!
channel.description:
# Whonix for VirtualBox
Download Whonix for VirtualBox:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/VirtualBox
----
This is a point release.
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Point_Release
----
# Upgrade
Alternatively, in-place release upgrade is possible upgrade using [Whonix repository](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Project-APT-Repository).
----
This release would not have been possible without the numerous supporters of Whonix!
----
Please Donate!
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Donate
----
Please Contribute!
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Contribute
----
# Major Changes
* OpenSSL security fix for Debian and Tor Browser (OpenSSL `1.1.1d`) ([CVE-2021-3449](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-3449)) * Tor Browser 10.0.15 * monero-gui [v0.17.1.9](https://gitlab.com/whonix/monero-gui/-/commit/3348e164eb7e8a391ad7fc590cf233c1fec37859) * [no longer install qtox by default Thanks to @madaidan for the suggestion! https://forums.whonix.org/t/tox-qtox-whonix-integration/1219/18](https://gitlab.com/whonix/anon-meta-packages/-/commit/b9de67e4a295cba8a223432e80fe88b41b3a1062) * New [anon-log](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor#anon-log) command line utility. * `anon-log` simplifies the manual [dump Tor log](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor#Dump_Tor_Log) command by only showing relevant log entries and no non-issues. * New `anon-consensus-delete` command line utility. * Tor Consensus Re-Download * While this persists [Tor Entry Guards](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Entry_Guards), it results in Tor re-downloading the Tor Consensus document. Should usually not be required. * disable the following Tor stream isolation ports * privoxy 9112 * polipo 9113 * Tor Browser Updater by Whonix Developers gpg key download 9116 (key hardcoded in package source code) * TorChat 9119 * mixmaster update 9120 * mixmaster 9121 * Tor Messenger 9153 * since deprecated applications in Whonix and no longer in use * [/usr/lib/anon-gw-anonymizer-config/torrc-d-cleaner: fix Avoid moving `/etc/torrc.d/95_whonix.conf` to `/etc/torrc.d/backup/95_whonix.conf.dpkg-new` during `anon-gw-anonymizer-config` package upgrades.](https://gitlab.com/whonix/anon-gw-anonymizer-config/-/commit/97baabc4b71abf6395ef0d1815cd63e74b7da050) * [install no longer no longer required auditd by default https://phabricator.whonix.org/T537](https://gitlab.com/whonix/anon-gw-anonymizer-config/-/commit/520f232dd68dafd9e66f0c78a37ebc3223d691c0) * [hardened-malloc-type-test](https://gitlab.com/whonix/helper-scripts/-/commit/0ae844a0b26e8d03b41eccc9d37ec0124bce7587) * [add hardened-malloc-enabled-test](https://gitlab.com/whonix/helper-scripts/-/commit/a536530ad078e29381ff9ced69ec26b3b840c88b) * [add new tool apparmor-watch](https://gitlab.com/whonix/helper-scripts/-/commit/8aabfbbe96595b92d8cc7bf35fb3ca690d9a2313) * [add minimum-time-check](https://gitlab.com/whonix/helper-scripts/-/commit/7ad34f8c7594d0ddcce4be12a660e2d0463649b9) * https://forums.whonix.org/t/constrained-system-resources-program-starter-wrapper/10914 * [Create apparmor-info ](https://gitlab.com/whonix/helper-scripts/-/commit/3ddf9feba6ddebc7657712c6a604c9dfe500889e)(Thanks to madaidan!) * [add /usr/bin/apt-get-reset](https://gitlab.com/whonix/usability-misc/-/commit/d8a390c2c546e560c9b31c483b9ab4bcc1f0b067)
build system:
* all packages are more standalone, no Whonix specific build dependencies (genmkfile) (packages can now be build without genmkfile)
[Whonix VirtualBox](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/VirtualBox):
* [Recommended VirtualBox version](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/VirtualBox/Recommended_Version): `6.1.18` * At time of writing. * Above link takes precedence.
[onion-grater](https://gitlab.com/whonix/onion-grater):
* [Improve systemd sandboxing ](https://gitlab.com/whonix/onion-grater/-/commit/1fd8701dd6197b3325b83ad03bfd9ecedbcbdee6)(Thanks to madaidan!) * [simplify 40_bitcoind.yml ](https://gitlab.com/whonix/onion-grater/-/commit/9539d88c7e0b8336b74586d8c93821cad946fc90)(Thanks to qubenix!) * [update 40_bitcoind.yml to work with bitcoind v0.21 ](https://gitlab.com/whonix/onion-grater/-/commit/f72b60124841b29440eaa46d1233bb0c11e411f6)(Thanks to qubenix!)
[Qubes-Whonix](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Qubes-Whonix):
* [install vm-config-dist also in Qubes-Whonix to have `QMLSCENE_DEVICE=softwarecontext` workaround available](https://gitlab.com/whonix/anon-meta-packages/-/commit/4e6db57c3fba6329dd1f23818523e43fa4e1e98d)
[sdwdate](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/sdwdate):
* improved sandboxing (Thanks to madaidan!) * refactoring * python pep8 * update onion time sources (Thanks to TNT!) * [increase timeout to 120 seconds due to slow onions](https://gitlab.com/whonix/sdwdate/-/commit/b73ef360769052e5eb2d7d3b8559bf48949b81af) * [sdwdate Time Replay Protection](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Sdwdate#sdwdate_Time_Replay_Protection) * document [sdwdate Clock Randomization](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Sdwdate#sdwdate_Clock_Randomization) * document [sdwdate Time Sources Criteria](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Sdwdate#sdwdate_Time_Sources_Criteria) (Thanks to TNT!)
[whonix-welcome-page](https://gitlab.com/whonix/whonix-welcome-page):
* [add link to https://web.archive.org/https://t.me/s/Whonix_All_News](https://gitlab.com/whonix/whonix-welcome-page/-/commit/6acfb9df72d8d45723368eefcd3852dcb99da5bc)
[sdwdate](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Kicksecure) Development:
* split [Anon Meta Packages](https://gitlab.com/whonix/anon-meta-packages) into Anon Meta Packages (Whonix) and [Kicksecure Meta Packages](https://gitlab.com/kicksecure/kicksecure-meta-packages) * renamed whonix-repository to repository-dist * renamed whonixsetup to setup-dist * renamed whonix-setup-wizard to setup-wizard-dist * renamed whonixcheck to systemcheck
----
# Noteable Changes
https://forums.whonix.org/t/whonix-changelog-15-0-1-5-4-15-0-1-7-2/11351
# Full difference of all changes
https://github.com/Whonix/Whonix/compare/15.0.1.5.4-developers-only...15.0.1.7.2-developers-only
----
(This forum post was previously a call for testers. No release critical bugs where found during the testing period. This forum post was therefore [transformed](https://forums.whonix.org/t/transform-whonix-testers-wanted-forum-news-post-into-whonix-release-forum-news-post-ok/11405) into a stable release announcement. See edit history.)

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix for VirtualBox - 15.0.1.7.2 - Point Release!
item.dc:creator: Melionix
item.description:
Hello! I decided to install this, and the “apparmor-everything” from another thread.
Now I get this while updating:

user@host:~$ upgrade-nonroot
Reading package lists...
W: chown to _apt:root of directory /var/lib/apt/lists/partial failed - SetupAPTPartialDirectory (13: Permission denied)
W: chmod 0700 of directory /var/lib/apt/lists/partial failed - SetupAPTPartialDirectory (13: Permission denied)
W: chown to _apt:root of directory /var/lib/apt/lists/auxfiles failed - SetupAPTPartialDirectory (13: Permission denied)
W: chmod 0700 of directory /var/lib/apt/lists/auxfiles failed - SetupAPTPartialDirectory (13: Permission denied)
E: Could not open lock file /var/lib/apt/lists/lock - open (13: Permission denied)
E: Unable to lock directory /var/lib/apt/lists/
W: Problem unlinking the file /var/cache/apt/pkgcache.bin - RemoveCaches (13: Permission denied)
W: Problem unlinking the file /var/cache/apt/srcpkgcache.bin - RemoveCaches (13: Permission denied)

Is this something I should post here, or over in the apparmor thread?

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix for VirtualBox - 15.0.1.7.2 - Point Release!
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
Patrick:

I see. Seems no longer reproducible. Happened only at first boot? If yes, could you please re-import and gather debug info right after first boot?

yeah cant reproduce anymore. good then nothing to worry about from this until something similar happen.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix for VirtualBox - 15.0.1.7.2 - Point Release!
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
Patrick:

Used kernel form backports as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Kernel? Well, in that case, re-run these instructions. That should get you up to date versions that match.

currently its working fine, i didnt use newer kernel but my backport opened and seems upgraded headers by default never the less this is not of an issue.

only issue that will reproduce vbox kernel headers panic (i think) when newer kernel version upgraded from buster stable then only in this case vbox will care to see where is the matched headers.

but i will match the kernel so as the headers now from backport and see if something gonna happen in the future.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix for VirtualBox - 15.0.1.7.2 - Point Release!
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
TNT_BOM_BOM:
host systemd[1]: Starting canary...
host systemd[1]: Started canary.
host canary-daemon[730]: /usr/lib/systemcheck/canary-daemon: INFO start
host canary-daemon[730]: INFO: Skip. Not counting workstation. Only gateway only.
host canary-daemon[730]: /usr/lib/systemcheck/canary-daemon: INFO end.

Looks good. No issue at the moment.

TNT_BOM_BOM:
  • Canary failed to start message first time booting WS:

I see. Seems no longer reproducible. Happened only at first boot? If yes, could you please re-import and gather debug info right after first boot?

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix for VirtualBox - 15.0.1.7.2 - Point Release!
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
TNT_BOM_BOM:
Patrick:

dpkg -l | grep linux-headers-amd64

linux-headers-amd64 5.10.13-1~bpo10+1

Patrick:

dpkg -l | grep linux-image-amd64

linux-image-amd64 4.19+105+deb10u11

Different versions. That’s a problem for kernel modules (such as VirtualBox) uses.

Used kernel form backports as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Kernel? Well, in that case, re-run these instructions. That should get you up to date versions that match.

linux image and linux header version need to match.

To compare with what Debian has, for example:

  • https://packages.debian.org/buster-backports/linux-image-amd64
  • https://packages.debian.org/buster-backports/linux-headers-amd64

If you have these versions installed, then everything should be good.

(Unless Debian has an issue such as in past https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=951315 - but should be OK at the moment.)

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix for VirtualBox - 15.0.1.7.2 - Point Release!
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Thank you for testing!

TNT_BOM_BOM:

So to fix it user should:

sudo apt install linux-headers-amd64 linux-headers-4.19.0-16-amd64

This is already documented here: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/VirtualBox/Recommended_Version

Instructions for installing VirtualBox on [image] Debian [image] Linux can be found for example on the [image] Whonix ™ for VirtualBox with XFCE page, which contains the following text.

  • Linux [image]: please press expand on the right side.

Instructions contain:

sudo apt-get install virtualbox-6.1 linux-headers-$(dpkg --print-architecture)

which results in installing the linux-headers-amd64 package which should always ensure that the required kernel header matching linux-image-amd64 package are installed in the right version.

Do you have that package installed? To check:

dpkg -l | grep linux-headers-amd64

Also interesting:

dpkg -l | grep linux-image-amd64
TNT_BOM_BOM:

this i think should be documented as well in whonix vbox-troubleshooting

Will do soonish.

TNT_BOM_BOM:
  • Canary failed to start message first time booting WS:

Could you please provide debug output?

sudo journalctl -b -u canary.service
TNT_BOM_BOM:
  • GW pulseaudio activated in vbox settings

Expected.
This is to simplify installation of https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Orca

TNT_BOM_BOM:
  • Tumbler thumbnail missing which is need to fix a warning pop-up whenever you open an image

Confirmed. Tracking issue here:
Which image viewer to install by default?

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix for VirtualBox - 15.0.1.7.2 - Point Release!
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
Tested the version on vbox here some what i found:

  • GW pulseaudio activated in vbox settings
  • Tumbler thumbnail missing which is need to fix a warning pop-up whenever you open an image
  • Vbox-Debian host issue (mostly specific), If debian renewed its kernel to newer version this will damage vbox kernel build which need to have new headers installs for the newer/compatible version of host kernel (not sure):

Running sudo /sbin/vboxconfig will give:

So to fix it user should:

sudo apt install linux-headers-amd64 linux-headers-4.19.0-16-amd64

Then run:

sudo /sbin/vboxconfig

this i think should be documented as well in whonix vbox-troubleshooting

  • Canary failed to start message first time booting WS:

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix for VirtualBox - 15.0.1.7.2 - Point Release!
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Whonix for VirtualBox

Download Whonix for VirtualBox:

Whonix – 15 May 20

VirtualBox

Whonix ™ for VirtualBox - Stable Version

This is a point release.

Whonix – 3 Apr 21

Point Release

What is a Point Release?

Upgrade

Alternatively, in-place release upgrade is possible upgrade using Whonix repository.

This release would not have been possible without the numerous supporters of Whonix!

Please Donate!

Whonix – 9 Dec 20

Donate

PayPal, Bitcoin, Monero, Bank Wire

Please Contribute!

Whonix – 4 Apr 21

Contribute

Spread, Follow, Develop, Testing, Donate. Contribute to Freedom Software / Open Source.

Major Changes

  • OpenSSL security fix for Debian and Tor Browser (OpenSSL 1.1.1d) (CVE-2021-3449)
  • Tor Browser 10.0.15
  • monero-gui v0.17.1.9
  • no longer install qtox by default Thanks to @madaidan for the suggestion! https://forums.whonix.org/t/tox-qtox-whonix-integration/1219/18
  • New anon-log command line utility.
    • anon-log simplifies the manual dump Tor log command by only showing relevant log entries and no non-issues.
  • New anon-consensus-delete command line utility.
    • Tor Consensus Re-Download
    • While this persists Tor Entry Guards, it results in Tor re-downloading the Tor Consensus document. Should usually not be required.
  • disable the following Tor stream isolation ports
    • privoxy 9112
    • polipo 9113
    • Tor Browser Updater by Whonix Developers gpg key download 9116 (key hardcoded in package source code)
    • TorChat 9119
    • mixmaster update 9120
    • mixmaster 9121
    • Tor Messenger 9153
    • since deprecated applications in Whonix and no longer in use
  • /usr/lib/anon-gw-anonymizer-config/torrc-d-cleaner: fix Avoid moving /etc/torrc.d/95_whonix.conf to /etc/torrc.d/backup/95_whonix.conf.dpkg-new during anon-gw-anonymizer-config package upgrades.
  • install no longer no longer required auditd by default https://phabricator.whonix.org/T537
  • hardened-malloc-type-test
  • add hardened-malloc-enabled-test
  • add new tool apparmor-watch
  • add minimum-time-check
  • constrained system resources program starter wrapper
  • Create apparmor-info (Thanks to madaidan!)
  • add /usr/bin/apt-get-reset

build system:

  • all packages are more standalone, no Whonix specific build dependencies (genmkfile) (packages can now be build without genmkfile)

Whonix VirtualBox:

  • Recommended VirtualBox version: 6.1.18
    • At time of writing.
    • Above link takes precedence.

onion-grater:

  • Improve systemd sandboxing (Thanks to madaidan!)
  • simplify 40_bitcoind.yml (Thanks to qubenix!)
  • update 40_bitcoind.yml to work with bitcoind v0.21 (Thanks to qubenix!)

Qubes-Whonix:

  • install vm-config-dist also in Qubes-Whonix to have QMLSCENE_DEVICE=softwarecontext workaround available

sdwdate:

  • improved sandboxing (Thanks to madaidan!)
  • refactoring
  • python pep8
  • update onion time sources (Thanks to TNT!)
  • increase timeout to 120 seconds due to slow onions
  • sdwdate Time Replay Protection
  • document sdwdate Clock Randomization
  • document sdwdate Time Sources Criteria (Thanks to TNT!)

whonix-welcome-page:

  • add link to https://web.archive.org/https://t.me/s/Whonix_All_News

sdwdate Development:

  • split Anon Meta Packages into Anon Meta Packages (Whonix) and Kicksecure Meta Packages
  • renamed whonix-repository to repository-dist
  • renamed whonixsetup to setup-dist
  • renamed whonix-setup-wizard to setup-wizard-dist
  • renamed whonixcheck to systemcheck

Noteable Changes

Whonix Changelog 15.0.1.5.4 -> 15.0.1.7.2

Full difference of all changes

https://github.com/Whonix/Whonix/compare/15.0.1.5.4-developers-only...15.0.1.7.2-developers-only

(This forum post was previously a call for testers. No release critical bugs where found during the testing period. This forum post was therefore transformed into a stable release announcement. See edit history.)

Read full topic
